title: 'Thank you so much': Cambodia supports Malaysia and the US, contribution to border resolution with Thailand
description:
PHNOM PENH (Phnom Penh Post/ANN): A prominent Cambodian analyst has shared his appreciation for the role played by Malaysian Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim, the Asean chair, in efforts to calm tense border disputes between Thailand and Cambodia and provide a venue for talks.

He noted that ...

title: IMF projects slow growth for Cambodia due to trade disruptions, border tensions
description:
PHNOM PENH (Xinhua): Cambodia's economic growth is projected to decelerate to 4.8 per cent in 2025 and 4 per cent in 2026, reflecting export volatility, declining remittances, a slowdown in tourism, and weak domestic demand, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) said on Wednesday.

Cambodia's growth...

title: IMF lowers Cambodia’s 2025 economic growth forecast, citing border issues, tourism decline
description: PHNOM PENH: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has downgraded Cambodia’s economic growth forecast for 2025 from its earlier projection of 6.2% to 4.8%, and for 2026 to 4%. The IMF cited negative impacts from border tensions, a decline in tourist arrivals and sluggish activity in the financial sec...

title: UAE–Cambodia CEPA to drive non-oil trade beyond $1bn by 2030
description:
The UAE and Cambodia Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) , which entered into force earlier this year, is set to raise non-oil trade beyond $1bn by 2030, according to Neak Oknha Kith Meng, President of the Cambodia Chamber of Commerce.

He described the agreement as “the foundational...

title: October cross-border trade hits 146.6 billion; Cambodia still sees 99% decline
description:
Breakdown of cross-border trade with neighbouring countries in October

For the four neighbouring countries, in October 2025, cross-border trade reached 65,334 million baht, a decrease of 17.5%. Exports were 36,088 million baht, a drop of 25.4%, while imports stood at 29,246 million baht, a decrease...
